post_text: Big thanks to Farmer Kati, student Jesse Fitzelle-Jones and interns ZuZu Crane, Rose Bell and Miranda Forman for helping to expand the gardens that will provide the Welcome House of South County kitchen with fresh vegetables this summer!
shared_text:
Welcome House of South County
August 1, 2017 at 10:55 AM ·

Friday, July 7, despite a torrential down-pour, four students, led by Kati Maginel, Farm Coordinator with the Compass School, a Charter School in Kingston, along with Welcome House staff and guests helped to expand the Welcome House gardens which provide fresh produce for the community kitchen during the summer months. Planting the herbs, lettuces, squash, beans, and greens were ZuZu Crane, Narragansett HS, Rose Bell, URI, Miranda Forman, East Bay Met School, Jesse Fitzelle-Jones, the Compass School, and Veronica Sweet and Joe Dziobek from Welcome House. The Compass School mission is towards environmental sustainability and social justice -- the farmers look forward to continuing to partner with Welcome house to support the kitchen and local foods community. We thank everyone for their contribution in helping Welcome House become more naturally self-sufficient.

We are pleased to announce that The Compass School Envirothon Team was named, for the second year in a row, the Middle School Champions at the Rhode Island Envirothon competition last Friday!

The competition, which was held at the Champlin Scout Reservation in Cranston, Rhode Island, included written, oral, and practical (field identification) tests in the areas of Soils, Wildlife, Forestry, and Aquatics, as well as a test and oral project presentation on this year's special topic, Urban/Community Forestry.

For the project, the team had to respond to a Request for Proposal (RFP) to develop an Urban/Community Forest Management Plan for the Narragansett Council of the BSA for the Champlin Scout Reservation, by demonstrating their knowledge of the components of the plan and creative ways to address the landowner's objectives for the plan.

Congratulations again to the students and Ms. Hilary for this outstanding accomplishment!

The Compass School excels on new rating system for schools.

Rhode Island has a new system for measuring and classifying school performance. The scores were released last Friday and The Compass School ranked 2nd highest out of 278 schools that received scores! Compass received a score of 94.33 out of 100 possible points. That earns Compass a classification of Commended. The new classification system takes into account how well “subgroups” such as special education perform on the tests, measures the percent of all groups of students scoring proficient and with distinction on the NECAP testing, measures how much students improve year-to-year,and measures progress on individual school goals.
